name: Summer Land

attributes.attribute: where the weather is always fair, flowers bloom endlessly, and fruit hangs ripe off the trees
the ogre who held queen Guinevere hostage
the fine knight who rescued queen Guinevere from Meleagant

sources: Monaghan, Patricia. The Encyclopedia of Celtic Mythology and Folklore. Checkmark Books, 2008.
text: A British folkloric site is known as Summer Land, or the Summer Country. It is often associated with the Otherworld, a place where the weather is always pleasant and flowers and fruit flourish abundantly. Additionally, the name Summer Land appears in certain texts as a reference to the land of Meleagant, the ogre who abducted queen Guinevere and held her captive until Lancelot came to her rescue.
